tweets.content:
Officially got into escrow for my first home!

This isn't really a flex but moreso a major thank you to everyone who's supported me for the past few years (and the haters of course LOL)

A little background about me if you didn't know 13 years ago I was homeless with nothing to my name. My family gambled away everything we've had. The years before all I've ever known was moving from one basement to another of someone else's home cuz that's all my parents could afford to rent. It's funny growing up I legit thought this shit was normal until I started to be extra confused why all my friends lived in the same place for 5+ years lmfao. Looking back, I truly learned life isn't fair, but your circumstances doesn't have to define who you are. And let me tell you, summers in NYC surviving on $5 a week is no fking fun. Promised myself at the time I'll never return to that life ever again if I could make it out.

Anyways don't wanna yap much, thank you guys for everything. As much as CT is full of shitheads and drama this and that, I'm truly grateful.

Much love to @PastelAlpha and all you on here.

tweets.content:
If you want to build a strong network but consistently get ghosted or ignored you have to realize standing out and providing value is critical.

In a sea of ‚Äúgive me a chance‚Äù and ‚Äúmentor me‚Äù how do you stand out, how do you provide value before receiving it; its definitely not shilling your pre bond bags in peoples DMs. How do you teach someone something you potentially understand better, how do you put your name and reputation on the line before asking for someone else‚Äôs time and money?

Few.

tweets.author: CookerFlips

tweets.content:
Interesting protocol that launched @ogprotocol 

Built by ex. @zynga founder Justin Waldron @jtwald 

The platform essentially allows for any coin community to create a play-to-earn game for their holders

Like $FARTCOIN holders can literally earn a % supply of $GFARTCOIN

Stakers essentially can get part of the minted Gamecoin plus ur stake returned

Builders I assume gets rewards as well

Players earn tokens by well playing lol

So basically this adds a layer of potentially utility esp if a coin community (like a meme one is super big and active)

If there's a respective game for your coin holdings and you're holding for long term you're basically getting a potential free APR on top of holding which is kinda dope.

tweets.author: CookerFlips

tweets.content:
10/10/25 Post mortem reflecting on the day

When it happened I was actually asleep cuz I'm sick so was trying to rest a bit more than usual. 

Did I expect this to happen, mmmm no. 

Did I lose a couple millions, mmmm yes. 

Was I prepared beforehand mentally and physically in case it did happen , mmmm sorta lmao

Luckily I never go all in, although it was a hefty loss, nothing I can't recoup over time. I'm blessed to have money outside of crypto, diff sources of income, a business and of course spot holdings. This is why I always preach YOU NEED TO BE DIVERSIFIED YOU NEED TO HAVE A STUPID FAT CUSHION TO LIVE ON. Funny enough I did stable like $1m+ cuz I was prepping stuff for family, had a fat credit card bill, and window shopping for a 720s ü§£ consider myself lucky cuz I literally did it hours before, too bad I didn't do more, oh well.

In that moment I reminded myself "this is the potential loss if market continues to go down, I'm not willing to add more margin from this point on". 

Where we go from here? 

You know it's crazy coming from 2016-2017, I always imagined the post ICO crash would never happen again and in a way it hasn't technically. -90% drawdown on majors prob wouldn't ever happen again considering institutional involvement. But to see such a violent reaction from alts shows how heavily levered people were in the wrong things (SUI, ATOM to name a few). 

But if any of yall know me I've been chugging along for years now, if I'm down 6-7 figs I'm still grinding. If I'm up 6-7 figs I'm still grinding. Does it suck, yea ofc, but like I say to everyone who needs encouragement, you made it there once you can FUCKING DO IT AGAIN.

Many of you got a good head on your shoulders, take a break, come back stronger, with every flush event (even this one) more opportunities will arise. I'm still here in @PastelAlpha, if anyone needs a push in the right direction I'm right here frens. We stay grinding on the trenches, we take breaks, we focus on our health, we shitpost and we run it back turbo (not really more like slowly and surely).

Anyways shoutout to some of the homies checking up on me I love yall so much, crazy to think we're just strangers online but people care a lot about each other and that's the bright side of things. @ShockedJS @NachSOL @Fredis @kavosiss @onChainPharoh @0xLungin 

But yea I'm mentally fine LMAO as fucked as it sounds this is the benefit of being emotionally numb to money, sometimes I wish I wasn't this way frfr

What we know:
- Biggest liquidation in crypto history over 20B+ 
- Cascading liquidations not only wiped long positions but also ADL kicked in for a lot of people's delta neutral hedges, recipe for disaster a lot of accounts were wiped
- Hyperliquid worked as intended, Lighter was down for period of time, Aster & Binance also had issues
- Potential (I'm gonna say confirmed honestly) insider trading on notable onchain wallet profited over 200m in shorts, prob a lot more across all platforms
- Wintermute + Ethena are operational

tl;dr: yap yap

tweets.author: CookerFlips

tweets.content:
I always tell people it doesn't matter whether majors are up or down a lot when it comes to trenching. You sometimes see more inexperienced traders say "BTC is ATH but trenches are dead".

People find confidence in trading when things are stable. Chop = good. If majors are volatile it's usually ok to dial it back as people are either more aggressive protecting their stack. This is where fear uncertainty and doubt comes from.

If you don't know when to sideline yourself, that's when.

0x6b1ccfcc54962bbee49e43e9b9fb78de52134444

Qi (Ê∞£) - the flow of life force that moves through all things - has long symbolized balance, rhythm, and unseen power. In the world of trading, Qi is the pulse of the market - the invisible current that moves prices, sentiment, and opportunity. 

The life force of the trenches. 
Just as ancient masters learned to harness Qi through discipline and awareness, today‚Äôs traders channel market energy through intuition, timing, and conviction.

When you understand Qi, you see that trading isn‚Äôt war - it‚Äôs balance. You don‚Äôt conquer volatility; you ride its breath. To trade with Qi is to align discipline with instinct, data with intuition, motion with meaning.

The flow is always there.
Those who master it, rise with it.

tweets.author: CookerFlips

tweets.content:
End goal isn‚Äôt to work forever, especially not for a necessary income; of course we love having passion projects throughout life but always consider how you‚Äôre gonna set yourself up in the future.

You should always strive for a way to make money while you‚Äôre asleep. Something that doesn‚Äôt hinge on the fact you need to be active in order for it to work. Ideally it‚Äôs consistent enough it doesn‚Äôt require capital injection (like yields don‚Äôt count).

You should also want an income where you always win. Generally speaking this requires capital investment upfront; decent rule of thumb or at least from personal experience is break even within 1-2 years and ride free off dividends (comes in many forms).

You should also look for income sources where the effort is highly disproportionate to the return. These tend to be a bit more rare but can be used as throw away capital or cushion for riskier investments (ex. Brand deals, one time contractual work etc.) If you‚Äôre the best at what you do you can charge obscene amounts.

Yields are important, boring ofc, high usage of capital, low returns but consistent expected values. 

Throwaway Hail Marys, these are like less than 1% of your net worth attempts at 100x returns. You don‚Äôt do many of these and generally don‚Äôt actively seek them out. But if you get lucky it may provide you all of the above in the long run.
